t: Malachi 1
The*p burden of the word of the Lord*s to Israel by Malachi.
Israel Beloved of God
“I*pn have loved you,” says the Lord.*s “Yet*ld you say, ‘In what way have You loved us?’ Was*ild not Esau Jacob’s brother?” Says*ld the Lord.*s “Yet*ld Jacob I have loved;
But*ld Esau I have hated, And*ld laid waste his mountains and his heritage For*ld the jackals of the wilderness.”

Even*ln though Edom has said, “We*ld have been impoverished, But*ld we will return and build the desolate places,” Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “They*pn may build, but I will throw down; They*ld shall be called the Territory of Wickedness, And*ld the people against whom the Lord*s will have indignation forever.
Your*ld eyes shall see, And*ld you shall say, ‘The*ld Lord*s is magnified beyond the border of Israel.’
Polluted Offerings

“A*pn son honors his*i father, And*ld a servant his*i master. If*ld then I am the Father, Where*ld is*i My honor? And*ld if I am*i a Master, Where*ld is*i My reverence? Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts To*ld you priests who despise My name. Yet*ld you say, ‘In what way have we despised Your name?’
“You*ln offer defiled food on My altar, But*ld say, ‘In*ld what way have we defiled You?’ By*ld saying, ‘The*ld table of the Lord*s is contemptible.’

And*ld when you offer the blind as a sacrifice, Is*ild it*i not evil? And*ld when you offer the lame and sick, Is*ild it*i not evil? Offer*ld it then to your governor! Would*ld he be pleased with you? Would*ld he accept you favorably?” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“But*ln now entreat God’s favor, That*ld He may be gracious to us. While*ild this is being done*i by your hands, Will*ld He accept you favorably?” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.

“Who*ld is*i there*i even among you who would shut the doors, So*ld that you would not kindle fire on*i My altar in vain? I*ld have no pleasure in you,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, “Nor*ld will I accept an offering from your hands.

For*ld from the rising of the sun, even to its going down, My*ld name shall*i be*i great among the Gentiles; In*ld every place incense shall*i be*i offered to My name, And*ld a pure offering; For*ld My name shall be great among the nations,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“But*ln you profane it, In*ld that you say, ‘The*ld table of the Lord*s is defiled; And*ld its fruit, its food, is*i contemptible.’

You*ld also say, ‘Oh,*ld what a weariness!’ And*ld you sneer at it,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts. “And*ld you bring the stolen, the lame, and the sick; Thus*ld you bring an offering! Should*ld I accept this from your hand?” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“But*ld cursed be*i the deceiver Who*ld has in his flock a male, And*ld takes a vow, But*ld sacrifices to the Lord what is blemished— For*ld I am*i a great King,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, “And*ld My name is*i to*i be*i feared among the nations.
Malachi 2
Corrupt Priests
“And*pn now, O priests, this commandment is for you.

If*ld you will not hear, And*ld if you will not take it*i to heart, To*ld give glory to My name,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, “I*ld will send a curse upon you, And*ld I will curse your blessings. Yes,*ld I have cursed them already, Because*ld you do not take it*i to heart.
“Behold,*ln I will rebuke your descendants And*ld spread refuse on your faces, The*ld refuse of your solemn feasts; And*ld one*i will take you away with it.
Then*ld you shall know that I have sent this commandment to you, That*ld My covenant with Levi may continue,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“My*ld covenant was with him, one*i of life and peace, And*ld I gave them to him that*i he*i might*i fear Me;*i So*ld he feared Me And*ld was reverent before My name.
The*ld law of truth was in his mouth, And*ld injustice was not found on his lips. He*ld walked with Me in peace and equity, And*ld turned many away from iniquity.
“For*ln the lips of a priest should keep knowledge, And*ld people*i should seek the law from his mouth; For*ld he is the messenger of the Lord*s of hosts.
But*ld you have departed from the way; You*ld have caused many to stumble at the law. You*ld have corrupted the covenant of Levi,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“Therefore*ld I also have made you contemptible and base Before*ld all the people, Because*ld you have not kept My ways But*ld have shown partiality in the law.”
Treachery of Infidelity
Have*pn we not all one Father? Has*ld not one God created us? Why*ld do we deal treacherously with one another By*ld profaning the covenant of the fathers?

Judah*ld has dealt treacherously, And*ld an abomination has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem, For*ld Judah has profaned The*ld Lord’s*s holy institution*i which He loves: He*ld has married the daughter of a foreign god.
May*ld the Lord*s cut off from the tents of Jacob The*ld man who does this, being awake and aware, Yet*ld who brings an offering to the Lord*s of hosts!

And*ln this is the second thing you do: You*ld cover the altar of the Lord*s with tears, With*ld weeping and crying; So*ld He does not regard the offering anymore, Nor*ld receive it*i with goodwill from your hands.

Yet*ld you say, “For what reason?” Because*ld the Lord*s has been witness Between*ld you and the wife of your youth, With*ld whom you have dealt treacherously; Yet*ld she is your companion And*ld your wife by covenant.

But*ld did He not make them*i one, Having*ld a remnant of the Spirit? And*ld why one? He*ld seeks godly offspring. Therefore*ld take heed to your spirit, And*ld let none deal treacherously with the wife of his youth.

“For*ln the Lord*s God of Israel says That*ld He hates divorce, For*ld it covers one’s garment with violence,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts. “Therefore*ld take heed to your spirit, That*ld you do not deal treacherously.”

You*ln have wearied the Lord*s with your words; Yet*ld you say, “In*ld what way have we wearied Him?”*i In*ld that you say, “Everyone*ld who does evil Is*ild good in the sight of the Lord,*s And*ld He delights in them,” Or,*ld “Where is*i the God of justice?”
Malachi 3
The Coming Messenger

“Behold,*pn I send My messenger, And*ld he will prepare the way before Me. And*ld the Lord, whom you seek, Will*ld suddenly come to His temple, Even*ld the Messenger of the covenant, In*ld whom you delight. Behold,*ld He is coming,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“But*ln who can endure the day of His coming? And*ld who can stand when He appears? For*ld He is*i like a refiner’s fire And*ld like launderers’ soap.
He*ld will sit as a refiner and a purifier of silver; He*ld will purify the sons of Levi, And*ld purge them as gold and silver, That*ld they may offer to the Lord*s An*ld offering in righteousness.
“Then*ln the offering of Judah and Jerusalem Will*ld be pleasant to the Lord,*s As*ld in the days of old, As*ld in former years.

And*ld I will come near you for judgment; I*ld will be a swift witness Against*ld sorcerers, Against*ld adulterers, Against*ld perjurers, Against*ld those who exploit wage earners and widows and orphans, And*ld against those who turn away an alien— Because*ld they do not fear Me,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“For*ln I am*i the Lord,*s I do not change; Therefore*ld you are not consumed, O sons of Jacob.

Yet*ld from the days of your fathers You*ld have gone away from My ordinances And*ld have not kept them.*i Return*ld to Me, and I will return to you,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts. “But*ld you said, ‘In*ld what way shall we return?’
Do Not Rob God
“Will*pn a man rob God? Yet*ld you have robbed Me! But*ld you say, ‘In*ld what way have we robbed You?’ In*ld tithes and offerings.
You*ld are cursed with a curse, For*ld you have robbed Me, Even*ild this whole nation.

Bring*ld all the tithes into the storehouse, That*ld there may be food in My house, And*ld try Me now in this,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, “If*ld I will not open for you the windows of heaven And*ld pour out for you such*i blessing That*ld there*i will*i not be*i room*i enough to*i receive*i it.*i

“And*ln I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, So*ld that he will not destroy the fruit of your ground, Nor*ld shall the vine fail to bear fruit for you in the field,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts;
“And*ld all nations will call you blessed, For*ld you will be a delightful land,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
The People Complain Harshly
“Your*pn words have been harsh against Me,” Says*ld the Lord,*s “Yet*ld you say, ‘What*ld have we spoken against You?’
You*ld have said, ‘It*ld is useless to serve God; What*ld profit is*i it*i that we have kept His ordinance, And*ld that we have walked as mourners Before*ld the Lord*s of hosts?
So*ld now we call the proud blessed, For*ld those who do wickedness are raised up; They*ld even tempt God and go free.’”
A Book of Remembrance

Then*pn those who feared the Lord*s spoke to one another, And*ld the Lord*s listened and heard them; So*ld a book of remembrance was written before Him For*ld those who fear the Lord*s And*ld who meditate on His name.
“They*ln shall be Mine,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “On*ld the day that I make them My jewels. And*ld I will spare them As*ld a man spares his own son who serves him.”
Then*ld you shall again discern Between*ld the righteous and the wicked, Between*ld one who serves God And*ld one who does not serve Him.
Malachi 4
The Great Day of God

“For*pn behold, the day is coming, Burning*ld like an oven, And*ld all the proud, yes, all who do wickedly will be stubble. And*ld the day which is coming shall burn them up,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, “That*ld will leave them neither root nor branch.
But*ld to you who fear My name The*ld Sun of Righteousness shall arise With*ld healing in His wings; And*ld you shall go out And*ld grow fat like stall-fed calves.
You*ld shall trample the wicked, For*ld they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet On*ld the day that I do this,”*i Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“Remember*ln the Law of Moses, My servant, Which*ld I commanded him in Horeb for all Israel, With*ild the statutes and judgments.
Behold,*ld I will send you Elijah the prophet Before*ld the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.*s
And*ld he will turn The*ld hearts of the fathers to the children, And*ld the hearts of the children to their fathers, Lest*ld I come and strike the earth with a curse.”
